alert.note: Alert for Alameda (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 10:32AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring and will continue through this afternoon as several more hours of heavy rainfall continue. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Alameda. Specifically, Alameda Creek near Niles in Niles Canyon along Highway 84 is at moderate flood stage with continued rises forecast. In addition, Arroyo de la Laguna near Verona and south of Pleasanton is at moderate flood stage and continuing to rise. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fremont, Hayward, Pleasanton, Union City and Sunol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
